English: I give (fut and aor indic active and infinitives only)
[in conditional sentences, makes aor vb mean 'would have']
(acc./gen./dat. only —also plural) him, her, it, them
I throw, I fire at, I hit (with a missile)
(+ dat.) I help, come to help
at any rate, even, at least
(with acc. and infin.) it is necessary
to give, to have given (aor infin)
I am allowed, I can (=it is permitted to me)
(+ subj. or opt.) in order that, in order to
(+ infin.) I hinder, prevent (someone from doing)
word, speech, argument, story, account, reason
(+ fut. infin.) I intend, am going to, hesitate

Greek: ὁ αὐτός, ἡ αὐτή, τὸ αὐτό

English: I know (present, participle and infinitive only)
long ago, in the past, formerly
I save, keep, get away safely (passive)
end (adv. in the end), at last, finally
by (with agent of passive verbs) (+ gen.)
I run away, flee, am accused, am banished
(with acc. and infin.) it is necessary
(or other superlative) as quickly (etc) as possible
that, so that, with the result that
